subject: vpp: expose BGRA surface formats on Ivybridge and Haswell.
commitMessage:
vpp: expose BGRA surface formats on Ivybridge and Haswell.

Allow for vaQuerySurfaceAttributes() to return BGRA and BGRX formats
for VPP on Ivybridge and Haswell. This is supported as both source
and target surface formats.

This fixes VA/EGL interop on Gen7 processors when a BGR[AX] surface
is exported into an EGLImage.

Change-Id: I94f0b174223f94b0a1155e32a17bb23ffb2792cf
Signed-off-by: Gwenole Beauchesne <gwenole.beauchesne@intel.com>
Bug-Tizen: TC-1195/related

subject: Build only for Intel architectures
commitMessage:
Build only for Intel architectures

This change should fix unresolvable state of the package
for arm targets. As libva builds exclusively for Intel archs
it's not availabe on arm and turns this package into
unresolvable state.

Change-Id: I4971c8dfab6eb4c4b99346b31de8977e8d013110
Signed-off-by: Ed Bartosh <eduard.bartosh@intel.com>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

LGTM. Merge ASAP.

Patch Set 1:

Halley, please submit
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 1:

does the change mean to exclude 64 bit platform support?
why?

Patch Set 1:

no, the change means to exclude ARM (or more specifically, to build exclusively on i586 and x86_64 architectures)

Patch Set 1: Verified+1 Code-Review+1

Ping !

This would solve the build errors for ARM targets:

https://build.tizen.org/project/monitor?blocked=0&building=0&dispatching=0&finished=0&project=Tizen%3ACommon&scheduled=0&signing=0&succeeded=0

Please review ASAP. Thx
Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased

Patch Set 2: Verified+1 Code-Review+2

thanks will be submitted along new version
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Fix video frame alpha issues while get video buffer from vaimage.
commitMessage:
Fix video frame alpha issues while get video
buffer from vaimage.

Be verified in Tizen IVI.

Origin: http://cgit.freedesktop.org/vaapi/intel-driver/commit/src/i965_post_processing.c?id=0d3462360f624750233d77771d55f48bc00039e5
Bug-Tizen: PTREL-789
Change-Id: I6115c0b4fb91079089a199835e5d0aa30b248dbe
Signed-off-by: Qing Zhang <qing.zhang@intel.com>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

Patch Set 1:

Hi, Halley. Please help to review this commit.
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 1: Verified+1

The same patch had been merged into libva-intel-driver upstream today. 

Please refer to 
================================
commit 0d3462360f624750233d77771d55f48bc00039e5
Author: Zhao Yakui <yakui.zhao@intel.com>
Date: Tue Apr 22 11:05:18 2014 +0800

    VPP: Set the alpha channel when doing the conversion from NV12 to RGBA on Ivy/Haswell/BDW

    Currently zero is written to alpha channel when doing the conversion
    from NV12 to RGBA(BGRA), which affects the following the rendering operation.

    Signed-off-by: Zhao Yakui <yakui.zhao@intel.com>
    (cherry picked from commit 4082c9db1eef45bc117fc151d60a178926ab9f73)
================================

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Are maintainers identified to merge this ? I am not granted too and been told it will unblock some IVI tasks

Patch Set 1:

We have two options to land it:

1. Merge it from tizen.org 
2. Cherry-pick from upstream by commit-id show as upper.

Patch Set 1:

I tried to cp 

http://cgit.freedesktop.org/vaapi/intel-driver/commit/src/i965_post_processing.c?id=0d3462360f624750233d77771d55f48bc00039e5

but it does not apply so I guess it's better to merge the adaption and skip it on next upstream rebase ...

Btw a Bug-Tizen: would help to track this that time

Patch Set 1:

The deadline for M6 image freeze is 4/24.

So, Does it possible to merge in here?

Patch Set 1:

I think the upstream commit should be taken by "cherry-pick" not by "cp" command directly.

Patch Set 1:

yes I meant cherry-pick , have git cp alias :-)
Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated

Patch Set 2:

humm i see I was pushed to accepted/tizen_generic

I dont think this is the right workflow
can you push it again to tizen branch?
Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2
Patch Set 2: Verified+1
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

Patch Set 2:

please submit change against appropriate branch. 
accepted/* are not development branches and will be overwritten automatically.

subject: Enable the Bay Trail platform.
commitMessage:
Enable the Bay Trail platform.

This patch adds PCI IDs for Bay Trail (sometimes called Valley View).
As far as the video driver is concerned, it's very similar to
Ivybridge GT1 except VP8 decoding support.
VP8 decoding support will be added later.
